## Natural history notes

Creeping primrose-willow (Ludwigia repens) is an annual wildflower that grows in moist soils near freshwater habitats. It serves as a food source for hawk moths and attracts a variety of insects. The species is widely distributed in Florida, and its range extends across the southeastern United States, Mexico, and parts of the Caribbean.
